I asked NPR's religion correspondent, Barbara Bradley Hagerty, what she makes of that Gallup poll we mentioned earlier and whether it means we're becoming less religious.
No, it doesn't mean that Americans are less religious.
Although among young people, belief in God is declining, but generally, polls show about 90 percent of Americans actually believe in God.
So what's happening here is there's really a decline in the trust in religious organizations.
People just don't want to go to church as much as they used to.
There's not the societal pressure to go.
So what you're seeing is a problem for the institutions, not a problem for God.

The sex abuse scandal is one of the biggest reasons Catholics have been expressing less and less confidence in their church over the past decade.

That's up for sale.
